title: Mobile Microlearning Course for Enhancing Online Teacher Education Effectiveness: Design Based on Social Learning Theory and Social Science Elements

context.prior_knowledge: Basic instructional theories and online learning platform experience, foundational understanding of social learning theories (e.g., Vygotsky’s Zone of Proximal Development), and general awareness of social science elements (citizenship, multicultural understanding, collaborative problem-solving)
context.additional_context: Learners are university students or job seekers aiming to strengthen practical competencies in online education design and implementation. Evaluates real-world application abilities through project-based assessments. Particularly emphasizes instructional design skills reflecting socio-scientific elements such as multicultural education, citizenship development, and collaborative problem-solving. Cultivates the ability to integrate core social studies concepts (history, geography, politics, culture) into curriculum design.

learning_goals: Apply core principles of online instructional design (social interaction design, content structuring, formative assessment) to develop a 5-week microlearning module emphasizing civic literacy and collaborative problem-solving in social science contexts.
Use digital tools (quiz makers, video editors, LMS) to enhance peer collaboration, create multicultural education materials, and improve participation rates by ≥20%.

Over six months, learners must conduct ≥3 feedback cycles (2 surveys, 1 focus group interview) to improve existing lecture materials, write a ≤5-page design plan integrating social studies concepts (history, geography, politics) with sociocultural contexts, and achieve ≥4 out of 5 rubric items rated “Excellent” (4+/5).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
